intro: Micrococca mercurialis, commonly known as the mercury plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical in shape. Micrococca mercurialis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
